title: bill/sparow
subtitle:
2019 Nov, 179 Medivac refugees arrived in Australia, NOT 1 is in Hospital today

More then 90% Never went to Hospital

And They Are all still in Australia?

More than 50 of these have been rejected by the US as “unfit”?

Anthony Albanese: The Medivac Bill is working as intended pic.twitter.com/a6dti5J0ID

title: Oxfam Australia
subtitle:
There are a record number of refugees worldwide - 29.5 million people.

At today's Global #RefugeeForum, countries must step up and do their fair share to fund refugee responses & offer to host refugees.

Our new report explains how https://oxf.am/36FRahK pic.twitter.com/o86cm6HipC

title: VicSRC
subtitle: @NovaPeris generously shares her story at the VCAA End of Year briefing. “Aboriginal woman have learnt to hold the pain in. We can’t get over the past because the past is still in us. We were refugees in our own country - denied our language, culture, spirituality. “ pic.twitter.com/VDfszd0l0p

title: Dylan Quinnell
subtitle: 116 countries are meeting at this week's Global #RefugeeForum to pledge their support for refugees & their host communities. With a record number of refugees worldwide, the time is now: https://oxf.am/36FRahK  #EveryoneCountspic.twitter.com/3TRgTmcsDy

title: Nicole Tooby
subtitle: The #US helped #Australia out by resettling some refugees, but that does not let Australia off the hook. Those who remain in Papua New Guinea and Nauru should be transferred immediately to Australia. New from @hrw’s @PearsonElaine in @GuardianAus: https://bit.ly/35z9Yza pic.twitter.com/S1Qc0GP7Fl

title: Tim Hatfield
subtitle:
5 years ago Kindu Abihara arrived in Australia from Ethiopia, a refugee and an orphan. Today he’s now one of thousands of students getting their year 12 results. He says the main thing though is he did his best and made his parents proud!
@7NewsAdelaide 6pm.pic.twitter.com/t8NVIxOtMo
